title: How Vital is the Jurisprudential Relevance: Law Article Intervened Legal Case Retrieval and Matching
author: Nuo Xu (Xi'an Jiaotong University), Pinghui Wang (Xi'an Jiaotong University), Zi Liang (Xi'an Jiaotong University), Junzhou Zhao (Xi'an Jiaotong University), Xiaohong Guan (Xi'an Jiaotong University), ..., Tsinghua University
relevance_why: The proposed model LCM-LAI employs multi-task learning and focuses on legal case retrieval and matching, which could enhance Haohe Liu's work on audio-related legal applications or generative audio systems that may need structured legal frameworks.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of automatically retrieving comparable legal cases from a large dataset based on a given legal query, focusing on jurisprudential relevance.
contribution: This paper introduces the LCM-LAI framework to solve the legal case retrieval and matching tasks, achieving state-of-the-art performance by capturing legal-rational information and applying an article-aware attention mechanism.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods heavily relied on expert annotation or applicable law articles as input, often lacking practicality in real-world scenarios.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work overcomes these limitations by eliminating the need for expert-guided inputs and utilizing a multi-task learning strategy to enhance case retrieval and matching.

key_innovation: Utilizes a unique attention mechanism that evaluates legal-rational similarity based on law distribution instead of traditional semantic similarity approaches.
real_world_impact: The proposed model can significantly improve the efficiency and accuracy of legal case retrieval systems in practical settings, assisting legal professionals in their research and decision-making.
limitations: The model may still face challenges in cases where applicable law articles are not well-defined or when the legal text is highly ambiguous.

new_terms.jurisprudential relevance: **Jurisprudential relevance** refers to the significance of legal principles and rules in assessing the similarity and applicability of cases in the legal domain.
new_terms.multi-task learning: **Multi-task learning** is an approach in machine learning where multiple tasks are learned simultaneously, leveraging shared representations to improve overall model performance.

open_sourcing: The source codes are available at https://github.com/prometheusXN/LCM-LAI
